catalog_info.title: The New Economic Criticism: Graduate Seminar
catalog_info.description: Focuses on issues of monetary and linguistic representation and exchange, with special attention to metaphorization, to historical introductions of new monetary economic and literary media, and to various kinds of connections between economic and aesthetic production. Readings include Heraclitus, Herodotus, Aristotle, Sophocles, medieval tales of the Holy Grail, Shakespeare, Rousseau, Goethe, Marx, Melville, Heidegger, and many theorists of digital representation and exchange in the twenty-first century.
